Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.Matrix
public class Matrix extends Object
This is the Matrix class. This defines matrices, primarily for use in the localizers. However, if matrices and matrix operations are necessary, this class as well as some operations in the MathFunctions class can absolutely be used there as well. It's similar to Mats in OpenCV if you've used them before, but with more limited functionality.

      columns - the number of columns, or width

      public Matrix(double[][] setMatrix)
      This creates a new Matrix from a 2D matrix of doubles. Please only enter rectangular 2D Arrays of doubles or else things mess up.
      Parameters:
      setMatrix - the 2D Array of doubles

  • Method Details

    • deepCopy

      public static double[][] deepCopy(double[][] copyMatrix)
      This creates a copy of a 2D Array of doubles that references entirely new memory locations from the original 2D Array of doubles, so no issues with mutability.
      Parameters:
      copyMatrix - the 2D Array of doubles to copy
      Returns:
      returns a deep copy of the input Array

    • getMatrix

      public double[][] getMatrix()
      This returns a deep copy of the 2D Array that this Matrix is based on.
      Returns:
      returns the 2D Array of doubles this Matrix is built on

    • get

      public double[] get(int row)
      This returns a specified row of the Matrix in the form of an Array of doubles.
      Parameters:
      row - the index of the row to return
      Returns:
      returns the row of the Matrix specified

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      This returns the number of rows of the Matrix, as determined by the length of the 2D Array. If the Matrix/2D Array is not rectangular, issues arise.
      Returns:
      returns the number of rows in the Matrix

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      This returns the number of columns of the Matrix, as determined by the length of the first Array in the 2D Array. If the Matrix/2D Array is not rectangular, issues arise.
      Returns:
      returns the number of columns in the Matrix

    • multiply

      public static Matrix multiply(Matrix one, Matrix two)
      This multiplies a Matrix to another Matrix. This will not change any data in the two input Matrices.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Matrix to multiply.
      two - the second Matrix to multiply
      Returns:
      returns if the operation was successful
